bibl.title: James A. Balch v. J.W. Waughop. Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle.
In the matter of the insanity of James A. Balch.

To the Honorable Judge of the Third Judicial District Court: J.W. Waughop, having been duly sworn, deposes and says: That I am the superintendent of the Hospital of the insane at Fort. Steilacoom, Washington Territory, and am the person to whom the within writ is directed and I hereby certify: That the cause of the detention of said James A. Balch and warrant of commitment issued by the Hon. J.A. Navarre, probate Judge of Yakima County, Washington Territory, which said warrant is directed to me and copies of the said complaint and warrant of commitment are hereto annexed and marked respectively Exhibit "A" and "B" and made part hereof: The same were issued in the manner and under the circumstances and for the purposes set forth therein.
The affiant further says that the said James A. Balch is not yet sufficiently recovered from his namis to be discharged from custody.

Subscribed and sworn to before me this 5th day of June A.D. 1888
Notary Public in and for Washington Territory.
